org.gvsig.raster.cache.buffer

Interface BufferNoData


  • public interface BufferNoData
    This class represents the nodata value.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte defaultByteNoDataValue 
      static double defaultDoubleNoDataValue 
      static float defaultFloatNoDataValue

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        java.lang.Number getValue()
        Gets a unique value for nodata. It doesn't take into account if the raster has several bands. Returns the same value for all of them.
        Returns:
        the noData

      • setValue

        void setValue(java.lang.Number noData)
        Sets a unique value for nodata. It doesn't take into account if the raster has several bands. Assigns the same value for all of them.
        Parameters:
        noData - the noData to set

      • isDefined

        boolean isDefined()
        Returns true if getValue is defined and false if is null
        Returns:

      • delete

        void delete()
        Deletes the nodata value.

      • restore

        void restore()
        Restores native value. The native is the original value saved in the head of the file or its metadata. This value has to be assign when NoData object is initialize.

      • getNativeValue

        java.lang.Number getNativeValue()
        The native is the original value saved in the head of the file or its metadata. This value has to be assign when NoData object is initialize
        Returns:
        the noData

      • setNativeValue

        void setNativeValue(java.lang.Number nativeNoDataValue)
        The native is the original value saved in the head of the file or its metadata. This value has to be assign when NoData object is initialize.
        Parameters:
        nativeNoDataValue -
